comment: Fraud and Forensic Accounting was an enjoyable class with Dana. We read some fraud cases each week and discussed the implications during class. He did a great job making the discussions feel energic and lively. There were 3 exams, a group project, and a participation grade. Exams are fairly easy if you go to class. Overall, it was a great time.

Great professor. This class was one exam, 3 papers, a group presentation, & participation. Very interesting class that is very different than any other course in the upper accounting classes. Dana is a very smart professor and really wants the best for his students!! Take him

I genuinely found every class interesting. He's a great prof who wants to give you useful info. Participate in class and proof read your papers and you should be fine. Engaging classes that aren't endless powerpoint slides. Easy to do well. He is 100% the prof to take for this class.

Really nice guy. Fraud was an interesting class taught by him! You definitely should study and prepare, but if you put a decent amount of effort, this is a pretty Easy A or at least B. His tests and free response and a little hard to prepare for, but he makes it obvious what he'll ask. Great elective class.

The nicest professor in all of Kennesaw. I loved going to class, hes funny and the lectures are super interesting. I recommend taking him for any class. His tests are all short answer. Don't think they will be super easy because the material is, you have to really know the information to get full credit. As long as you study well they are easy A's.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Such an amazing professor! Makes students want to attend class. The class itself is really interesting. Tests are in essay format. If you are thinking about taking a class with him, don't think twice! You will not regret it! We need more teachers like him!!!

Dana is quite a darn good professor. He's very knowledgable and truly wants his students to learn. The bad thing is that his exams are essay format, which would typically mean that grades would be higher. Not the case. I'm a straight A student and always made high B's on my exams, even though I was sure I would make at least a low A.
Most of the MAcc classes are a joke, but Fraud and Governance was easily the best of the really good ones. The papers and class discussions were interesting. A really great professor.

Special topics course on forensic accting. Very sweet professor. Super helpful. Short answer & scenario exams, no final but have two small group projects. No books. Just reading articles that he provides.
Great for accounting begginners. He is fun and makes things easy to understand. Do the homework and don't miss class!

Requires a group presentation and homework and there is a lot to be learned and the tests are tough.  But he is a very caring and attentive professor and makes the material interesting.  And yes, he's cute.
Good teacher, awesome for entry level ACCT.  Just make sure to go, and you will learn plenty to move on to the next level.
